page.title: 20Manton Racehorses
page.content: Racehorses have been trained for many years on Manton Downs. At Manton House they are fed on oats and hay at 7 a.m. every morning. Then they are ridden for an hour or two, except on Sundays, while the stables are cleaned out. There are 6 gallops for training on the 2000 acres_some flat, some uphill. Between 30 and 40 people work there, looking after the horses. About 80 racehorses are kept, half of them American bred. The youngest are one year old. Some stay until they are 6 years old. They are taken to races at Ascot, Newbury, Salisbury, Bath and Newmarket. One of the most famous horses to be trained at Manton was called Gainsborough.
